intro: Heterocoma erecta, commonly known as the erect heterocoma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to dry conditions such as reduced leaf size and deep root systems. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits known as cypselae. Heterocoma erecta is often found in rocky soils and is considered a valuable component of local ecosystems.
